paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Objective:** Become familiar with Zeppelin's data visualization features
**File locations:**
**Successful outcome:** Creation and manipulation of  Zeppelin visualizations, making them available for collaboration, and using Zeppelin to create a shareable report.
**Before you begin:**
**Related lessons:** Zeppelin overview

---

%md
# Setup
---

paragraphs.title: Retrieve the bank data
paragraphs.text:
%sh
rm bank*
hdfs dfs -rm /user/zeppelin/bank.csv
wget http://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/machine-learning-databases/00222/bank.zip
unzip bank.zip
rm bank.zip
hdfs dfs -put bank.csv /user/zeppelin/

%md
# Lab
---

%md
We need to put this data into a table to play with the visualization features.
Don't worry about the two lines of Scala below just execute them.
We will explain those later.
~~~
val bankdata = spark.read.option("header","true").option("inferSchema","true").option("delimiter",";").csv("bank.csv")
bankdata.createOrReplaceTempView("bankdatatemp")
~~~

paragraphs.title: 1 - Create a temp table for visualization purposes
2 - Check that you have created an Hive temporary table

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 3 - Quickly browse through the five data visualizations available by default in Zeppelin

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
Edit your SQL query so that it only shows data for individuals over the age of 30. Run the query and note the change in the chart.

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
Click on the settings link in the paragraph above and notice that Zeppelin has selected the age column as the key column and is showing the sum of the balances for all individuals in
each age bracket. 
Display the average balance instead of the sum of balances.

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
Click and drag the available marital field into the Groups category to modify the visualization so that data is shown not only by age, but also grouped by marital status. 
When you are finished, click the settings link again to close the pivot chart options.

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
Add a dynamic form to the SQL query that allows you to filter out data where the maximum balance for any individual exceeds a certain threshold, 
but set the default to 1,000,000 so that it doesn’t immediately modify the chart. Rerun the query with this new code, then use this dynamic form to adjust the maximum balance to $10,000 and $5,000 and note the effects on the visualization.

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 8 - Questions
paragraphs.text:
%md
* Why do you think changing the maximum balance from $10,000 to $5,000 had so little effect on the chart?
* What group (married, single, or divorced) had the most change based on changing the maximum balance?

paragraphs.title: 9 - Share the chart above
paragraphs.text:
%md
Create a URL that allows you to share this chart with others without giving them access to the code or the Zeppelin note.
Use the linked page to change the maximum balance to $2,500, then return to your note and observe the effects the change had at the source.

%md
* Clone the paragraph at step 3
* Clone the paragraph at step 7
* Adjust the width of both paragraphs

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

[{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 11 - We are now ready to prepare this note for sharing
paragraphs.text:
%md
1. Create a clone copy of this note named 'DataVisualizationClone'. Also export a copy of the note.
2. Open the 'DataVisualizationClone' note in a separate tab and hide the code for all paragraphs. 
3. Then hide the output for every paragraph except for the two that are on the same line.
4. Next, convert this from the default view to report view. 

**Now the URL to this note is ready to share with your stakeholders.**

paragraphs.title: 12 - Import the note you previously exported
paragraphs.text:
%md
Import the copy of this note you made earlier and name the new note 'DataVisualizationImported'.
Confirm that the copy contains all original code and formatting.

paragraphs.title: Result
paragraphs.text:
%md
# Result
**You have now:** You have successfully created and manipulated Zeppelin visualizations, made them available for collaboration, and used Zeppelin to create a shareable report.

---

%md
# Solution
---

paragraphs.title: 1 - Create a temp table for visualization purposes
paragraphs.text:
val bankdata = spark.read.option("header","true").option("inferSchema","true").option("delimiter",";").csv("bank.csv")
bankdata.createOrReplaceTempView("bankdatatemp")

paragraphs.title: 2 - Check that you have created an Hive temporary table
paragraphs.text:
%sql
SHOW TABLES

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 3 - Quickly browse through the five data visualizations available by default in Zeppelin
paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT * FROM bankdatatemp

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 4 - Apply a filter
paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT * FROM bankdatatemp WHERE age > 30

paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT * FROM bankdatatemp WHERE age > 30

paragraphs.title: 6 - Add a group
paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT * FROM bankdatatemp WHERE age > 30

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 7 - Add a dynamic form
paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT * FROM bankdatatemp WHERE age > 30 AND balance <= ${Maximum Balance}

paragraphs.title: Additional resources
paragraphs.text:
%md
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Hortonworks Apache Spark Tutorials](http://hortonworks.com/tutorials/#tuts-developers) are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
2. [Hortonworks Community Connection (HCC)](https://community.hortonworks.com/spaces/85/data-science.html?type=question) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Hortonworks Apache Spark Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/spark-overview/content/analyzing_data_with_apache_spark.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Hortonworks Apache Zeppelin Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/zeppelin-overview/content/overview.html) - official Zeppelin documentation.
%angular
%angular
